heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 311 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3639 lux) and cloud levels (up 217 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 310.6m lower than yesterday, 96.3m lower than the past week, 217.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 845m minimum and 2560m maximum, with an average of 1093.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1190.0m and 1311.1m.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and some sunny spells will occur. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
